info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 17 at 12:29AM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Pickens County through 100 AM EDT... At 1229 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles southwest of Pickens, or over Six Mile, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Pickens, Easley, Central, Liberty, Norris, Six Mile, Lake Keowee and Nine Times. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
